story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in the Ethiopian Highlands, there lived a young boy named Samuel. Samuel was a kind and curious boy who loved to explore the beautiful countryside and learn about the world around him.

One day, as Samuel was wandering through the fields, he came across an old and wise man named Melaku. Melaku was known throughout the village for his knowledge of the natural world and his ability to communicate with animals.

Samuel was fascinated by Melaku and asked him how he was able to talk to the animals. Melaku smiled and told Samuel that it was a gift that he had been born with, but that anyone could learn to understand and communicate with animals if they listened carefully and observed their behavior.

Samuel was determined to learn this skill, and for many months he studied with Melaku, learning about the different sounds and body language that animals use to communicate. He practiced listening and observing, and before long, he was able to understand the animals just as Melaku did.

One day, as Samuel was walking through the forest, he heard a faint cry for help. He followed the sound and soon came upon a young bird with a broken wing. Samuel carefully picked up the bird and cradled it in his hands.

He spoke to the bird in a soothing voice, telling it that he would take care of it and help it heal. The bird looked up at Samuel with its bright, trusting eyes and chirped softly.

Samuel took the bird back to Melaku, who helped him mend the broken wing. Over the next few weeks, Samuel cared for the bird, feeding it and keeping it warm. And every day, the bird would chirp and sing, thanking Samuel for his kindness.

Eventually, the bird's wing healed, and Samuel knew it was time for it to return to the wild. He brought the bird to the edge of the forest and opened his hands. The bird looked at him for a long moment, then spread its wings and took flight.

Samuel watched as the bird soared through the sky, singing a beautiful song of gratitude and freedom. And he knew that he had made a friend for life.

From that day on, Samuel continued to use his gift of understanding animals to help those in need. And he always remembered the important lesson that Melaku had taught him: that by listening carefully and observing the world around us, we can learn to communicate with all living beings and build lasting bonds of friendship and love.

And with that, my dear son, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you too have the power to make a difference in the world, just like Samuel. Goodnight, my dear one.
